intro: Lepanthes duidensis, commonly known as the Duidé's orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining substrates for optimal growth. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
